hackathon-description-text: Coding4TX's Hackathon @ Galvanize brings students together to work with tech mentors and compete for the prizes listed on the site. All attendees will also get C/I SWAG and free food all day long from 9am - 5pm!

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Managing Director, Innovation Strategy & Partnerships, Teach For America, National
Past President & CEO at Las Comadres Para Las Americas
Fellow, Hack Reactor; CS Teacher, KIPP
Director, South by Southwest (SXSW) Innovation Festival

hackathon-eligibility:
Your group must have between 3 and 5 participants from your school.
All students must complete an initial brainstorming activity before they arrive at the hackathon.
All students must have their permission slips upon arrival or have their teacher e-mail permission slips to
hackathon-requirements:
PLANNING GUIDE: 
Use this guide to help you plan and organize your project 
You need to describe your problem and solution (related to bias or civics) that you've identified, validated, and developed in detail.
Describe the problem that you are trying to solve with your team and why it is a problem.  Explain the validation process that you used and the results of your validation process (i.e. "We surveyed __ people and __ people said that this was a good problem.  This is why we decided to continue working on this problem.)
Describe your tech solution that helps to solve your problem and why it is a good solution.  Be detailed while describing the features and explain the results of the validation process for your solution, as well. (i.e. "We surveyed __ people and __ people said that this was a good solution.  This is why we decided to continue working on this solution.)
You will plan the layout of your product with at least three wireframes or product sketches on the website that you present at the end of the day.  
 
EACH GROUP HAS 4 DELIVERABLES DUE TODAY:
hackathon-rules: Here are a few guidelines for the day:

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Four Little Bits kits for the winning team, with a ton of fun ahead building awesome circuits, gizmos, gadgets, and bitsbots.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Most Creative Solution - High School Prize
Most Creative Solutions - Middle School Prize

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=118 Nueces St, Austin, TX 78701, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Does the product offer a solution to combating an issue that is negatively impacting our students and their peers?  Was the pitch effective?  Is the idea original and unique?

How well did the team present their project? Was the idea well communicated? Were the visuals engaging and appropriate? Did the team share presentation responsibilities? Was there a hook to build audience interest?

Did you choose to focus on a major social issue related to bias? Does your tech product have the potential to solve it? Is the idea original & unique, or a just a copy of something that already exists?
Does the product offer a solution to combating an issue that is negatively impacting our students and their peers? Was the pitch effective? Is the idea original and unique?

How well did the team present their project? Was the idea well communicated? Were the visuals engaging and appropriate? Did the team share presentation responsibilities? Was there a hook to build audience interest?

Did you choose to focus on a major social issue related to bias? Does your tech product have the potential to solve it? Is the idea original & unique, or a just a copy of something that already exists?

hackathon-description-header: A Coding4TX student hackathon powered by Code/Interactive hosted by Galvanize
